ratings.comment: I loved the readings and listening to her talk! That being said we got our first grade more than halfway through the semester. My grade was tanked by my participation score. I talked once per class but that was not enough which was frustrating to learn with only a few weeks left. Talk to her about your grade early in the year if you take this class

Dr. Amine is approachable and clearly has tons of knowledge and passion for her work. Overall, my rating comes from a lack of clear grading policies, as the TA in the class generally graded based on arbitrary information not discussed before the assignment was due. I enjoyed her course material, but wish there was more consistency in what's wanted.

The professor did not have any clear expectations for her students. Every week, points would be taken away for something different, and the TA wrote comments as if we were in an advanced English class. She changed the weekly assignments to quizzes, completely altering the course structure. Do not take this class, it's not even an English class.
She's very knowledgeable and has lots of interesting insights to share. She's conversational and easy to approach when needed.

Seems like a nice person but there are no rubric so it is very hard to know what is required. TA and professor will say that you need something but will still dox points or will not follow through. Requires way too much reading and work outside of class, this class is perfect if you have no life outside of class.

Lecture are boring and forgettable. Idk how she has a rating above 2 because this is easily the worst class. Its on par with victor jew with the amount of reading (150 pages a week :) ). The grading is even worse since theres no rubric and you will get points off stuff that IS NEVER MENTIONED ANYWHERE and you will get blamed for it. Fantastic class

This class requires you to be very analytical about what you are reading. It was very clear Dr. Amine was very passionate about the class and while the lectures could be boring they were overall not bad. I generally dislike English, but enjoyed this class. If you aren't good at writing maybe you should skip this class.

The reading was pretty reasonable but her class is extremely unstructured and unclear. Very vague grading criterion and the canvas is genuinely unusable. However, if you participate and read, the things she wants you to get from the reading are obvious. If you raise your hand and voice something new to the class, you will get a decent grade.
Do not take her class. her class average is significantly lower than the other professors teaching this course. Is not understanding- very difficult grader for an intro english course.

Attendance is mandatory! Class is very heavy on reading and understanding the “deeper” meaning of those readings. You have to talk at least 3 times a class period to receive full credit for participation. She doesn't put any grades into canvas until the end of the semester, so you never know what your grade is in the class. Seems like a nice person

You have to write one paper, and she barely follows her grading rubric. If you are not an English major, you will not get a good grade on this paper. You also have to speak up in class, or you will get a bad grade for participation. I'm sure she is a nice person, but she is extremely nitpicky. Material is heavy so make sure you prepare to analyze.

She doesn't put in any grades until literally the last second. You go the entire semester without knowing your grade. She grades nitpicky and barely lays out proper rubrics for assignments. The final project had NO proper rubric despite students asking for one. Her lectures are very boring and forgettable. She seems nice, but she grades horribly.
